thread.title: Wheatley shot first, but found himself outgunned
thread.title_full: Wheatley shot first, but found himself outgunned

title: Wheatley shot first, but found himself outgunned
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Wheatley shot first, but found himself outgunned Martin Wheatley: hostile Published at 12:01AM, July 18 2015 Hostile approach to financial giants sowed seeds of regulator’s downfall 
For many in the financial services industry, the departure of Martin Wheatley from the Financial Conduct Authority was a long overdue removal of someone who had bungled the running of the regulator and made no friends with his unpredictable and hostile approach. 
For consumer groups, it was the opposite. Richard Lloyd, the executive director of Which?, said that the group “had strongly supported the transformation of the financial regulator from lapdog to watchdog” under Mr Wheatley. 
John Mann, a rare supporter of Mr Wheatley on the Treasury select committee, added that in sacking Mr Wheatley, the chancellor was “nothing but Subscribe now
